Module org.kquiet.jobscheduler
Package org.kquiet.jobscheduler

Class JobController

java.lang.Object
org.kquiet.jobscheduler.JobController
public class JobController extends Object
This class controls whole execution process of all associated jobs.

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start()

    • start

      public void start(Iterable<JobBase> jobList)
      Start to initialize jobs and schedule them by configuration.
      Parameters:
      jobList - the jobs to be scheduled; if not presented, this controller will try to load job from jobscheduler.config

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stop this controller and all scheduled jobs it manages.

    • pause

      public boolean pause(JobController.PauseTarget target, boolean autoResumable)
      Pause the execution of specified target.
      Parameters:
      target - the target to pause
      autoResumable - indicate whether this pause could be resumed automatically
      Returns:
      true if paused, otherwise false

    • pause

      public boolean pause(JobController.PauseTarget target)

    • resume

      public boolean resume(JobController.PauseTarget target, boolean autoResumable)
      Resume the execution of specified target.
      Parameters:
      target - the target to resume
      autoResumable - indicate whether this resume is automatically or manually
      Returns:
      true if resumed, otherwise false

    • resume

      public boolean resume(JobController.PauseTarget target)

    • isPaused

      public boolean isPaused(JobController.PauseTarget target)

      Parameters:
      target - the target to check
      Returns:
      true if paused, otherwise false

    • forwardEvent

      public final void forwardEvent(JobBase sourceJob, Object event)
      Forward event from source job to the other managed jobs.
      Parameters:
      sourceJob - the job raising the event
      event - the event object to forward

      target - the target to pause

      Accept a browser task to be executed in internal browser.
      Parameters:
      task - browser task
      Returns:
      true if the browser task is successfully accepted, otherwise false
